poem:
Title: "Elegy of the Feira de Acari"

In the heart of Rio, a bazaar breathes no more,
Rattling bones of stalls silent in the sun.
Child of '70, marketborn Manoel implores,
"Are we thieves, for making life from none?"

Survivor of bullets, trader on time-torn streets,
His wheels now turned in the grit of despair.
The Feira has fallen, its pulse retreats,
In the city's rhythms, a haunting silence there.
